paragraphs.zh-tw: This sound, this smell, this sight all remind me of the campfires of my childhood, when anyone could become a storyteller in front of the dancing flames. There was this wondrous ending when people and fire fell asleep almost in unison.
paragraphs.en: 這聲音 這氣味 這景象 都讓我回想起童年時分的篝火 任何人都能在跳躍的火焰前成為講故事的人 結尾更是神奇 人們和火焰一起和諧地入睡

paragraphs.zh-tw: It was dreaming time. Now my story has a lot to do with dreaming, although I'm known to make my dreams come true.
paragraphs.en: 這是夢的時刻 我的故事多數是關於夢的 雖然我靠實現夢想成名

paragraphs.zh-tw: Last year, I created a one-man show. For an hour and a half I shared with the audience a lifetime of creativity, how I pursue perfection, how I cheat the impossible.
paragraphs.en: 去年，我創造了一場個人秀 在一個半小時的時間裡 與觀眾分享我創造性的一生 如何追逐完美，如何欺騙不可能

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then TED challenged me: "Philippe, can you shrink this lifetime to 18 minutes?" Eighteen minutes, clearly impossible. But here I am.
paragraphs.en: TED對我提出挑戰： “菲力浦，可以把這一生濃縮成18分鐘嗎？” 18分鐘——明顯不可能 但我還是來了

paragraphs.zh-tw: One solution was to rehearse a machine gun delivery in which every syllable, every second will have its importance and hope to God the audience will be able to follow me. No, no, no.
paragraphs.en: 一個方法是說得像機關槍一樣快 每個母音每秒鐘都有它的意義 然後向上帝祈禱觀眾能跟上我的速度#￥&*@%…… 不，不，不

paragraphs.zh-tw: No, the best way for me to start is to pay my respects to the gods of creativity. So please join me for a minute of silence.
paragraphs.en: 不，於我最好的開場方式 是像創造力的神明致敬 請跟我一起默默享受接下來的一分鐘

paragraphs.zh-tw: Okay, I cheated, it was a mere 20 seconds. But hey, we're on TED time.
paragraphs.en: 好吧，我耍賴了，這只有20秒 不過我們是在TED次元嘛

paragraphs.zh-tw: When I was six years old, I fell in love with magic. For Christmas I got a magic box and a very old book on card manipulation.
paragraphs.en: 我六歲時 愛上了魔術 我拿到的聖誕禮物是一本魔術書 一本非常古老的介紹紙牌魔術的書

paragraphs.zh-tw: Somehow I was more interested in pure manipulation than in all the silly little tricks in the box. So I looked in the book for the most difficult move, and it was this.
paragraphs.en: 我對純粹玩牌技巧的興趣 遠遠超過黑箱子裡的花哨戲法 我在書裡找到了其中最難的一項技法 像這樣

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now I'm not supposed to share that with you, but I have to show you the card is hidden in the back of the hand. Now that manipulation was broken down into seven moves described over seven pages.
paragraphs.en: 我不該把這秘訣告訴你們 不過你們看，紙牌被藏在手的背面 這個技法 (在書中)被分解為七個步驟 用七頁篇幅詳細描述

paragraphs.zh-tw: One, two, three, four, five, six and seven. And let me show you something else.
paragraphs.en: 一、二、三、 四、五、六、七． 我還要告訴你們一點

paragraphs.zh-tw: The cards were bigger than my hands. Two months later, six years old, I'm able to do one, two, three, four, five, six, seven.
paragraphs.en: 紙牌比我的手大 兩個月後，才六歲 我就能做完一、二、三、四、五、六、七

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I go to see a famous magician and proudly ask him, "Well what do you think?" Six years old. The magician looked at me and said, "This is a disaster.
paragraphs.en: 於是我去見一位有名的魔術師 驕傲地問他：“你覺得怎樣？” 才六歲啊 魔術師看著我說：“一場災難

paragraphs.zh-tw: You cannot do that in two seconds and have a minuscule part of the card showing. For the move to be professional, it has to be less than one second and it has to be perfect." Two years later, one -- zoop.
paragraphs.en: 你不能花上兩秒鐘(才完成動作) 還有牌角露出來了 這個動作的專業標準是用時不到一秒鐘 必須完美。” 兩年後，數到一

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I'm not cheating. It's in the back. It's perfect. Passion is the motto of all my actions.
paragraphs.en: 我可沒耍花招。牌在背面，非常完美 熱情 是我所有作為的座右銘

paragraphs.zh-tw: As I'm studying magic, juggling is mentioned repeatedly as a great way to acquire dexterity and coordination. Now I had long admired how fast and fluidly jugglers make objects fly.
paragraphs.en: 在學習魔術的過程中 拋接戲法被反復提及 極適合訓練靈活性和協調性 我一直很羡慕拋接雜耍演員的快速和流暢 讓物品飛起來

paragraphs.zh-tw: So that's it. I'm 14; I'm becoming a juggler. I befriend a young juggler in a juggling troupe, and he agrees to sell me three clubs.
paragraphs.en: 就它了！我十四歲。我要成為一個拋接雜耍演員 我認識一個拋接雜耍劇團的年輕演員 他同意賣給我三根拋接棒

paragraphs.zh-tw: But in America you have to explain. What are clubs? Nothing to do with golf. They are those beautiful oblong objects, but quite difficult to make.
paragraphs.en: 在美國你需要解釋一下什麼是拋接棒 跟高爾夫可沒關係 是美麗的橢圓形物體 很難製作

paragraphs.zh-tw: They have to be precisely lathed. Oh, when I was buying the clubs, somehow the young juggler was hiding from the others.
paragraphs.en: 必須準確地分佈重量 我買它們的時候 那個年輕雜耍演員故意躲著別人

paragraphs.zh-tw: Well I didn't think much of it at the time. Anyway, here I was progressing with my new clubs.
paragraphs.en: 我當時不以為意 不管怎樣，我用那套新拋接棒開始練習

paragraphs.zh-tw: But I could not understand. I was pretty fast, but I was not fluid at all.
paragraphs.en: 但弄不明白 我能做得很快，但無法變得流暢

paragraphs.zh-tw: The clubs were escaping me at each throw. And I was trying constantly to bring them back to me.
paragraphs.en: 棒子隨著每次拋出不斷脫出我的掌控 我不得不一直把它們找回來

paragraphs.zh-tw: Until one day I practiced in front of Francis Brunn, the world's greatest juggler. And he was frowning.
paragraphs.en: 直到有一天我在Francis Brunn面前演練 世界上最棒的拋接雜耍者 他皺起眉頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: And he finally asked, "Can I see those?" So I proudly showed him my clubs. He said, "Philippe, you have been had.
paragraphs.en: 最後他問：“可以給我看看嗎？” 我驕傲地亮給他看我的棒子 他說：“菲力浦，你被騙了。

paragraphs.zh-tw: These are rejects. They are completely out of alignment. They are impossible to juggle." Tenacity is how I kept at it against all odds.
paragraphs.en: 這些是次品，重心完全歪了 用它們可玩不轉拋接戲法。” 韌性 是我克服困難堅持下來的法寶

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I went to the circus to see more magicians, more jugglers, and I saw -- oh no, no, no, I didn't see. It was more interesting; I heard.
paragraphs.en: 我參加了馬戲團，去看更多的魔術師，更多的拋接雜耍者 我看到——哦不，不是看到 比看到更有趣：是聽說

paragraphs.zh-tw: I heard about those amazing men and women who walk on thin air -- the high-wire walkers. Now I have been playing with ropes and climbing all my childhood, so that's it. I'm 16; I'm becoming a wire walker.
paragraphs.en: 我聽說了那些神奇的演員 在空中漫步 高空走索者 我整個童年階段都在玩繩子和攀爬 就它了！我十六歲。我要成為走鋼索者。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I found two trees -- but not any kind of trees, trees with character -- and then a very long rope. And I put the rope around and around and around and around and around till I had no more rope.
paragraphs.en: 我找到兩棵樹 不是普通的樹 而是兩棵很有個性的樹 一根很長的繩子 將繩子繞一圈又一圈 一圈又一圈，直到繞完為止。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now I have all of those ropes parallel like this. I get a pair of pliers and some coat hangers, and I gather them together in some kind of ropey path.
paragraphs.en: 有了這樣一段段平行的繩子 我又用兩隻老虎鉗和一些衣架 把繩子集中在一起成為一條繩子軌道

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I just created the widest tightrope in the world. What did I need? I needed the widest shoes in the world.
paragraphs.en: 這樣我做出了世界上最寬的鋼索 我還需要什麼？我需要世界上最寬的鞋子

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I found some enormous, ridiculous, giant ski boots and then wobbly, wobbly I get on the ropes. Well within a few days I'm able to do one crossing.
paragraphs.en: 我找到一雙大到離譜、十分搞笑的滑雪靴 蹣跚著，我走上了繩索 幾天後我就能走上一回了

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I cut one rope off. And the next day one rope off.
paragraphs.en: 於是我剪斷一根繩子 第二天再剪斷一根

paragraphs.zh-tw: And a few days later, I was practicing on a single tightrope. Now you can imagine at that time I had to switch the ridiculous boots for some slippers.
paragraphs.en: 又過了幾天，我就只剩下一根繩索了 可想而知 當時我就能把搞笑的滑雪靴換成輕便的舞鞋

paragraphs.zh-tw: So that is how -- in case there are people here in the audience who would like to try -- this is how not to learn wire walking. Intuition is a tool essential in my life.
paragraphs.en: 這就是——以防在場觀眾有人想要嘗試 這就是學習走鋼索最不可取的方法 直覺，是我人生中最本質的手段

paragraphs.zh-tw: In the meantime, I am being thrown out of five different schools because instead of listening to the teachers, I am my own teacher, progressing in my new art and becoming a street juggler. On the high wire, within months, I'm able to master all the tricks they do in the circus, except I am not satisfied.
paragraphs.en: 那段時間，我先後被五所不同的學校開除 因為我從不聽從老師 我以自己為師，鑽研我的新藝術 成為一個街頭雜耍藝人 在高空鋼索上，不過幾個月 我就精通了馬戲團演員的所有絕技 但我並不滿足。

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was starting to invent my own moves and bring them to perfection. But nobody wanted to hire me.
paragraphs.en: 我開始發明自己的新動作，並練習到盡善盡美 沒有人願意雇用我

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I started putting a wire up in secret and performing without permission. Notre Dame, the Sydney Harbor Bridge, the World Trade Center.
paragraphs.en: 於是我開始偷偷地假設鋼索，在未經許可的場所演出 巴黎聖母院 悉尼海港大橋 世貿中心

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I developed a certitude, a faith that convinced me that I will get safely to the other side. If not, I will never do that first step.
paragraphs.en: 我開始形成一種信念 說服我定能安全抵達對面 否則，我絕不會邁出第一步

paragraphs.zh-tw: Well nonetheless, on the top of the World Trade Center my first step was terrifying. All of a sudden the density of the air is no longer the same.
paragraphs.en: 儘管如此 在世貿中心的屋頂上 我的第一步極為駭人 忽然間空氣密度變了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Manhattan no longer spreads its infinity. The murmur of the city dissolves into a squall whose chilling power I no longer feel.
paragraphs.en: 曼哈頓不再顯得廣闊無邊 都市的細語化作嚎叫 我不再感到那股冰冷的力量

paragraphs.zh-tw: I lift the balancing pole. I approach the edge. I step over the beam.
paragraphs.en: 我舉起平衡杆，走向大樓邊緣 我跨過桁梁

paragraphs.zh-tw: I put my left foot on the cable, the weight of my body raised on my right leg anchored to the flank of the building. Shall I ever so slightly shift my weight to the left? My right leg will be unburdened, my right foot will freely meet the wire.
paragraphs.en: 左腳踏上鋼索 我的重心從右腳上 移動到大樓的側邊 我要不要繼續把體重移到左腳上 我的右腿可以放輕鬆 我的右腳就能自由地踏上鋼索

paragraphs.zh-tw: On one side, a mass of a mountain, a life I know. On the other, the universe of the clouds, so full of unknown we think it's empty.
paragraphs.en: 一邊是崇山，是我熟知的生活 另一邊是雲海 充滿未知，以至我們以為虛空

paragraphs.zh-tw: At my feet, the path to the north tower -- 60 yards of wire rope. It's a straight line, which sags, which sways, which vibrates, which rolls on itself, which is ice, which is three tons tight, ready to explode, ready to swallow me.
paragraphs.en: 我腳下是延伸到北塔的路——60碼長的鋼索 那是一條直線，下垂著 搖擺著，顫動著 自身扭轉 那是冰 那是三噸重的緊繃，隨時可能爆發 隨時可能將我吞噬

paragraphs.zh-tw: An inner howl assails me, the wild longing to flee. But it is too late.
paragraphs.en: 體內有一個聲音吼叫著攻擊著我 無法抑制地渴望逃離 然而太遲了

paragraphs.zh-tw: The wire is ready. Decisively my other foot sets itself onto the cable.
paragraphs.en: 鋼索嚴陣以待 我決然地邁出另一隻腳

paragraphs.zh-tw: Faith is what replaces doubt in my dictionary. So after the walk people ask me, "How can you top that?" Well I didn't have that problem.
paragraphs.en: 信念，取代了猶豫 在我的詞典裡 完成這次演出後 人們問我，“你怎麼超越你自己？” 這於我不是問題

paragraphs.zh-tw: I was not interested in collecting the gigantic, in breaking records. In fact, I put my World Trade Center crossing at the same artistic level as some of my smaller walks -- or some completely different type of performance.
paragraphs.en: 我對收集壯舉 或打破記錄都沒有興趣 事實上，我把世貿中心的那次演出 與其他小型的演出放在同一個藝術水準上 有些甚至是完全不同形式的演出

paragraphs.zh-tw: Let's see, such as my street juggling, for example. So each time I draw my circle of chalk on the pavement and enter as the improvising comic silent character I created 45 years ago, I am as happy as when I am in the clouds.
paragraphs.en: 比如說，相似於我的街頭雜耍 每一次 當我在人行道上用粉筆畫出一個大圓圈 然後像即興默劇演員那樣進入圓圈的範圍 這是我45年前想出的噱頭 這與在雲端上同樣高興

paragraphs.zh-tw: But this here, this is not the street. So I cannot street juggle here, you understand.
paragraphs.en: 但是此時此地 並不是街頭 請理解我不能做街頭雜耍

paragraphs.zh-tw: So you don't want me to street juggle here, right? You know that, right? You don't want me to juggle, right? (Music) Thank you. Thank you. Each time I street juggle I use improvisation.
paragraphs.en: 你們都不希望我做街頭雜耍，對不對？ 你們懂的，對不對？ 你們不會讓我雜耍的，對不對？ (鼓掌聲) (音樂) (鼓掌聲) 謝謝。謝謝 每一次我做街頭雜耍 都運用到即興

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now improvisation is empowering because it welcomes the unknown. And since what's impossible is always unknown, it allows me to believe I can cheat the impossible.
paragraphs.en: 即興的力量在於 它歡迎未知 因為不可能總是未知的 它讓我相信我可以去欺騙不可能

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now I have done the impossible not once, but many times. So what should I share? Oh, I know. Israel.
paragraphs.en: 至今我完成不可能的任務已不止一次 而是許多次 我揀哪次來說？哦對了，是以色列那次。

paragraphs.zh-tw: Some years ago I was invited to open the Israel Festival by a high-wire walk. And I chose to put my wire between the Arab quarters and the Jewish quarter of Jerusalem over the Ben Hinnom Valley.
paragraphs.en: 幾年前我被邀請做以色列節的開場演出 是一次高空走索表演 我選擇架設鋼索的地方 在耶路撒冷阿拉伯區和猶太區之間 在欣嫩子谷上方

paragraphs.zh-tw: And I thought it would be incredible if in the middle of the wire I stopped and, like a magician, I produce a dove and send her in the sky as a living symbol of peace. Well now I must say, it was a little bit hard to find a dove in Israel, but I got one.
paragraphs.en: 我設計了一個驚人的場面 在鋼索中間 我停下來，像魔術師那樣 變出一隻鴿子，將它送上天空 象徵和平 現在我要說 在以色列找只鴿子真不容易，不過我找到了

paragraphs.zh-tw: And in my hotel room, each time I practiced making it appear and throwing her in the air, she would graze the wall and end up on the bed. So I said, now it's okay. The room is too small.
paragraphs.en: 每次我練習變出鴿子扔向半空 它都會擦上牆，最後掉在床上 我覺得無所謂。房間太小了嘛 我的意思是，鳥需要空間去飛

paragraphs.zh-tw: I mean, a bird needs space to fly. It will go perfectly on the day of the walk.
paragraphs.en: 我的意思是，鳥需要空間去飛 正式演出那天絕對沒有問題

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now comes the day of the walk. Eighty thousand people spread over the entire valley.
paragraphs.en: 到了正式演出那天 整個山谷裡聚集了8萬民眾

paragraphs.zh-tw: The mayor of Jerusalem, Teddy Kollek, comes to wish me the best. But he seemed nervous.
paragraphs.en: 當時的耶路撒冷市長泰迪•科勒克走過來祝我好運 但他看上去很緊張

paragraphs.zh-tw: There was tension in my wire, but I also could feel tension on the ground. Because all those people were made up of people who, for the most part, considered each other enemies.
paragraphs.en: 我的鋼索緊緊抻著 地面上也彌漫著緊張的氣氛 因為在場的群眾 一直以來 都當對方是敵人

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I start the walk. Everything is fine. I stop in the middle.
paragraphs.en: 我開始走了，一切順利 我停在中間

paragraphs.zh-tw: I make the dove appear. People applaud in delight.
paragraphs.en: 我變出了鴿子 人們驚喜地鼓掌

paragraphs.zh-tw: And then in the most magnificent gesture, I send the bird of peace into the azure. But the bird, instead of flying away, goes flop, flop, flop and lands on my head.
paragraphs.en: 我以極佳的姿勢 將這只和平之鳥送上蔚藍的天空 但這只鳥並沒有飛走 而是撲騰撲騰地落到了我的頭上

paragraphs.zh-tw: And people scream. So I grab the dove, and for the second time I send her in the air.
paragraphs.en: 有人尖叫起來 我抓起這只鴿子 試圖第二次將它送上天空

paragraphs.zh-tw: But the dove, who obviously didn't go to flying school, goes flop, flop, flop and ends up at the end of my balancing pole. You laugh, you laugh. But hey.
paragraphs.en: 這只笨鳥顯然沒有上過飛行學校 又撲騰撲騰地，結果停在了平衡杆的一端！ 真好笑，真好笑——嘿！

paragraphs.zh-tw: I sit down immediately. It's a reflex of wire walkers. Now in the meantime, the audience, they go crazy.
paragraphs.en: 我立馬坐下。這是走索者的反射動作 就在這時，觀眾沸騰了

paragraphs.zh-tw: They must think this guy with this dove, he must have spent years working with him. What a genius, what a professional.
paragraphs.en: 他們可能認為這傢夥 也許已跟這只鴿子合作多年 多天才！多專業！

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I take a bow. I salute with my hand. And at the end I bang my hand against the pole to dislodge the bird.
paragraphs.en: 我彎腰鞠躬，伸手行禮 之後在杆子上狠狠地來了一掌 趕走鴿子

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now the dove, who, now you know, obviously cannot fly, does for the third time a little flop, flop, flop and ends up on the wire behind me. And the entire valley goes crazy.
paragraphs.en: 那只鴿子，你們現在都知道了它明顯不會飛 撲騰了第三回 最後落在我身後的鋼索上 整個山谷都沸騰了

paragraphs.zh-tw: Now but hold on, I'm not finished. So now I'm like 50 yards from my arrival and I'm exhausted, so my steps are slow.
paragraphs.en: 等等，我還沒走完 我離終點還有50碼 我現出疲態，步履緩慢

paragraphs.zh-tw: And something happened. Somebody somewhere, a group of people, starts clapping in rhythm with my steps.
paragraphs.en: 這時發生了一件事 不知從哪裡，有人，是一群人 開始和著我的步伐拍手

paragraphs.zh-tw: And within seconds the entire valley is applauding in unison with each of my steps. But not an applause of delight like before, an applause encouragement.
paragraphs.en: 片刻之後整個山谷 整齊地按著我的步子鼓掌 這回並不是像先前那樣是由於驚喜 而是充滿鼓勵

paragraphs.zh-tw: For a moment, the entire crowd had forgotten their differences. They had become one, pushing me to triumph.
paragraphs.en: 在那一刻，整個人群忘記了他們的分歧 他們齊心協力，助我成功

paragraphs.zh-tw: I want you just for a second to experience this amazing human symphony. So let's say I am here and the chair is my arrival.
paragraphs.en: 我希望你們也能短暫地 體會一下這神奇的人體交響 打比方說我在這裡，椅子就是我的終點

paragraphs.zh-tw: So I walk, you clap, everybody in unison. (Clapping) So after the walk, Teddy and I become friends.
paragraphs.en: 我來走，你們鼓掌，大家拍整齊 (拍手聲) (鼓掌聲) 這次表演後，泰迪和我成為朋友

paragraphs.zh-tw: And he tells me, he has on his desk a picture of me in the middle of the wire with a dove on my head. He didn't know the true story.
paragraphs.en: 他告訴我他在辦公桌上放了一張我的照片 拍的是我在鋼索中間，頭上頂了只鴿子 他還不知道真實情況

paragraphs.zh-tw: And whenever he's daunted by an impossible situation to solve in this hard-to-manage city, instead of giving up, he looks at the picture and he says, "If Philippe can do that, I can do this," and he goes back to work. Inspiration.
paragraphs.en: 每當他快被無法解決的困境嚇退 在這個棘手的城市 不是放棄，而是看著我的照片，對他自己說 “如果菲力浦能做到，我也能做到。” 然後回頭去工作 靈感

paragraphs.zh-tw: By inspiring ourselves we inspire others. I will never forget this music, and I hope now neither will you.
paragraphs.en: 通過激發自己 我們能啟迪他人 我永遠無法忘記這音樂 我希望你們也不會忘記

paragraphs.zh-tw: Please take this music with you home, and start gluing feathers to your arms and take off and fly, and look at the world from a different perspective. And when you see mountains, remember mountains can be moved.
paragraphs.en: 請把這音樂帶回家 開始在自己的手臂黏上羽毛 起飛、翱翔 從另一個視角觀察這個世界 當你遇見高山 記住：山可移。 (鼓掌聲)

paragraphs.zh-tw: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you.
paragraphs.en: 謝謝。謝謝。 謝謝各位 (鼓掌聲)

title: Philippe Petit The Journey Across The High Wire
